intro: Psychotria educta, commonly known as the "Lucky Plant" or "Good Luck Plant," is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is believed to bring positive energy in some cultures. Psychotria educta is also noted for its ability to thrive in low-light conditions, making it a popular houseplant.
